article.title: NGC 6819: testing the asteroseismic mass scale, mass loss, and evidence for products of non-standard evolution

multiple_choice_question.text: Which background model (equation) is preferred for KIC 4937576 based on the Bayesian Information Criterion (BIC)?
Which background model generally performs better at describing the power spectra of stars with low νmax (below the location of the red clump)?
Which background model consistently shows significant deviations in the determined νmax compared to other models, particularly at low νmax?
What is the approximate age of the isochrone from PARSEC shown in the color-magnitude diagram?
Which type of red giant star typically shows power spectra with each order containing a single dipole mode, similar to main-sequence stars?
According to this scaling relation, how does the large frequency separation (∆νfit) change with increasing frequency of maximum power (νmax)?
choices: ∆νfit increases with a power of 0.766 of νmax
∆νfit decreases with a power of 0.766 of νmax

multiple_choice_question.text: Based on this figure, what can be said about the ability to distinguish between RGB and RC stars using the small frequency separation (δν02) normalized by the large frequency separation (∆νfit)?
choices: It is impossible to distinguish between RGB and RC stars using this parameter.
This parameter clearly separates the two evolutionary phases for the shown masses.
This parameter only separates the two evolutionary phases for low-mass stars.
This parameter only separates the two evolutionary phases for high-mass stars.

multiple_choice_question.text: What does the tilted line of data points in the mass-distance modulus plane indicate about the relationship between errors in mass and radius estimates?
choices: An overestimate of mass will lead to an underestimate of radius.
An underestimate of mass will lead to an overestimate of radius.
An error that causes an overestimate of mass also results in an overestimate of radius.
Errors in mass and radius estimates are independent of each other.

multiple_choice_question.text: What does the good agreement between theoretical and empirical corrections to Δν suggest about the need for a correction to the other global parameter, νmax, for red giant stars?
choices: A significant correction to νmax is needed for both RGB and RC phases.
A significant correction to νmax is needed only for the RGB phase.
A significant correction to νmax is needed only for the RC phase.
No correction to νmax is needed for either the RGB or RC phase.
